alert.note: Alert for Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:13PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern San Juan and southeastern Kane Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Lake Powell, or 18 miles east of Page, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Powell. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Lake Powell. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
